title: [solved]820-3437
message:
Looking for help here.
Works perfect until lid gets closed upon which I guess an smc reset keeps happening. When the lid is closed for a short while you hear the chime and it reboots and either comes back on or stays off. Then power button to get going again. Sometimes I have to do another smc reset because it comes on with no backlight. This doesn't worry me however because it only happens when the first problem happens. 

I have swapped I/o board and trackpad. Smc_lid is 3.4v when open and 0 when closed. I have changed r5171 as well. 
Totally stuck as to why when closing lid it decides to restart. So thanks in advance for the time spent helping.

title: [solved]820-3437
message: have a look at the hall effect sensor for corrosion, that can cause messed up readings

title: [solved]820-3437
message: Hall sensor issue will never cause a reboot.

title: [solved]820-3437
message: Problem solved. Ppbus_s5_hs_computing_isns line was not being created.

title: [solved]820-3437
message: It would be stone cold dead without that rail......

title: [solved]820-3437
message:
Must of been the ic because I changed as well and there was small corrosion around pin 17 and r7202 had a hole in it. 
The problem 100% was fixed after doing so anyway
